titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 143
CWG12075

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
2
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, April 9th, 1864
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 143.
(Extract.)
3. The following officers are hereby relieved from further duty with the troops of the Veteran Reserve Corps, and will rejoin their respective regiments, without delay: --

1st Lieutenant John D. Shepard, 5th Kentucky Volunteers.
2d Lieutenant Val Melcher, 6th Kentucky Volunteers.
2d Lieutenant James Farran, 1st Kentucky Volunteers.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
April 9. 1864
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G --
The following officers are relieved from further duty with the troops of the Veteran Reserve Corps and will join their respective Regiments without delay.

1st Lieut J. D. Shepard 5th Ky Vols.
2nd Lieut Val Melcher 6th Ky Vols
2nd Lieut James Farran 1st Ky Vols.
